title: Let Kog'Maw eat things
body:
**Innate - Hunger Never Sleeps:**  Whenever a champion dies near Kog'Maw, they leave behind Delicious Snacks for ten seconds.  If Kog'Maw collects Delicious Snacks, he recovers (amount) health and mana.  Additionally, picking up Delicious Snacks refreshes the cooldown on Bio-Arcane Barrage and removes the Living Artillery debuff.

Probably the biggest disconnect between Koggy's lore and his gameplay is the fact that he *never eats anything*.  This Innate remake would solve that problem while also addressing two of the biggest barriers to Kog's success on Rift, his crippling mana issues and his woefully inadequate up-time on his W.  Due to Kog's habit of eating *anything*, allowing him to nom dead allied champions would make sense.  It also fits well with the 'kill Kog first' imperative that his presence on a team sets.  However, if need be, it could be restricted to enemy champions only.

Often times champions focused on long-range and staying away from the enemy team have Innate that reward them from moving in closer and taking risks.  Of the top of my head, {{champion:99}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} all have Innates like this.

Notice what they have in common?

They're all champions with super long-range kits that normally encourage them to stay FAR away.  But their Innates reward them for taking risks.

This is the same sort of idea I had for Koggy's Innate.

Getting Snacks from an Assassin or Fighter who dives you would be easy.  They would basically be left at Kog's feet.  Same for a snack from an allied champion who died protecting you.  Picking up Snacks that are further away would be more difficult, more risky, but also rewarding.  Maybe increase the healing on Snacks that spawn further away from Kog to make them more attractive?

But all those Mages also have better ways of defending themselves than KogMaw (I.e. hard CC, mobility, or even shields) and even then they only need to get within distance to auto attack as opposed to standing on top of it. Most of them don't even require their passive to function past the laning phase because in teamfights running in close for that auto attack is still too dangerous for a long range, squishy Mage. KogMaws goal, similarly, is to stay far away from diving Assassins and Fighters/Juggernauts and his team's goal is to keep them off of him so I can't see enemy corpses as being reliables you close to him.

Part of the concept behind his Innate change is that it would further underline the fact that a team wants to protect Koggy.  If an ally sacrifices themselves to protect Kog, he can heal off that.  If his team protects him from a diver, he can heal off that as well.

The Innate that he has right now actually *rewards* him for getting killed by a diver.  That's the exact opposite of how Kog should work.  Picking up the Delicious Snacks would also be a risk for Koggy.  Does he want to move a bit out of position to grab one, or should he hang back and risk his W giving up the ghost at the worst possible moment?

Think of it in terms of ganks bottom lane.

Say Kog's side manages to kill one enemy (or the enemy kills his support).  He can pick up the Snack and suddenly POW!  His HP is higher and his W just got refreshed.  It would give him an edge to keep up the fight.  Though I suspect the most common use would be to kill a diver and then heal up.  It helps to really hammer home the *kill Kog first!* imperative that Koggy is supposed to bring to the table.  Because if you don't he's just going to heal and eat your whole team.

As far as the vomiting and eating, a lot of arthropods spit or inject digestive enzymes onto things and then drink the soupy froth that results.  Because bugs are weird.
